records.full_caption: Fig. 1 (a) Normalized UV−Vis absorption spectra of P1 and P2 in CHCl3. (b) Normalized UV−Vis absorption spectra of P3, P4, P5, and P6 in CHCl3.
records.caption: Fig. 1 (a) Normalized UV−Vis absorption spectra of P1 and P2 in CHCl3. (b) Normalized UV−Vis absorption spectra of P3, P4, P5, and P6 in CHCl3.

records.full_caption: Fig. 3  Spectroelectrochemical analysis of green polymers. (a) P3, (b) P4 (c), P5, and (d) P6. Spin-coating polymers on an ITO-coated glass slide in 0.2 M TBAP/PC electrolyte solution using Ag/Ag+ as a quasi-reference electrode and a platinum wire as the counter electrode. The applied potentials change from (a) −0.2 V to +1.15 V, (b) −0.2 V to +1.2 V, (c) −0.2 V to +1.2 V, and (d) 0 V to +1.35 V.
records.caption: P4

records.full_caption: Fig. 4  Colorimetry of green polymers in the initial neutral state and fully oxidized states. Symbols enclosed in squares represent the most oxidized states, and others represent neutral states.

Fig. 5 (a) A schematic illustration of the electrochromic device. (b) Transmittance spectra of the electrochromic device (P4) between −0.5 and 1.2 V. The insets show photographs of the same device in reduction and oxidation states. (c) Transmittance data at 450 nm measured during the double-potential chronoamperometric experiment.
records.caption: Transmittance data at 450 nm measured during the double-potential chronoamperometric experiment.
